review: Hubby and I stopped by for a "Veterans Day free tavern double"    Apparently his burger was delicious, (3 stars for that)  I ordered a side of sweet potato fries! Large Portion=Full and filled Basket however they were cold.  Must've been cooked before the burger.  Usually busy in the evenings.

This restaurant is always packed. The staff and service are great. It's always been clean. Sometimes the wait is quite long for a table.  The noise is what keeps us from going here. It's a deafening roar from all the people. It's just too much.

I went here for lunch on New Years eve. Food was good but I never got the campfire sauce I asked for. Not really a big deal but still irritating.Our waitress was very unattentive. Apparently her friends were at the next table and she was more interested in visiting with them than doing her job. Also there were waitresses all around the restaurant doing their makeup. This is the third time in a row i've had shitty service here. I won't be back. There are so many better places to eat.

Avoid this place at all cost. This location is horrendous!!! The servers were sitting down eating with the managers. The bus boys were eating left over French fries from customers. Worst Red Robin experience ever!!!!! And our food took over a hour to get. Seriously? If I could give this place negative stars I would. AVOID THIS LOCATION PLEASE.

It was my birthday and I called in to order my free birthday burger! When I came to pick it up they wouldn't give it to me for free because I hadn't made an account already. I offered to make one on the spot but they said it takes 24 hours to process. I spoke to the manager, Cody, who was very kind but wouldn't budge on the burger and was trying to make me pay $15 for the burger even though I was alone on my birthday and I kind of started crying a little bit :( A nice stranger stepped up and bought it for me, but I can't believe they would rather throw out food and send me away on my DAY OF BIRTH all sad instead of sacrificing 15 of their corporate dollars. Step up guys.

The family voted Red Robin for the nostalgic feel tonight (as I'm visiting from out of state) and was very disappointed by the lack of attentiveness from our server (no checking in and no drink refilled). I had the taco tavern burger and the bun was stale

The server was extremely rude and judged our order and there was ketchup in the menus. And the tables were disgusting and sticky and seated by the back door with the workers coming in and out. And entire time we were laughing and having a good time, this one blonde worker would give us the stink eye. Made us feel really uncomfortable. I DO NOT RECOMMEND

Wait time for gross food, walk on the floors you slide from all the grease and dirt build up. You order cheese burgers and fries and it was cold and waitress looked at us like we were crazy when we told her.
Horrible service.  Rude wait staff (one particular waiter comes to mind).   Will never visit this location again

This was the 3rd and last time we give them our business.   Several months ago the wait staff seemed MIA.  Then the food was cold by the time it was served.    Today's fiasco started with a long wait before anyone showed up to seat guests.  Then the waitress forgot to serve the drinks until after the food was served, even though others around us were getting  drinks.  We asked for more fries, but they never came.    Staff doesn't seem to know what they're doing.

I normally avoid places with poor ratings but I thought, "It's Red Robin... how bad could it really be?" Well, not great.  Firstly, I love technology. And the instant gratification of ordering from a device at the table could be cool, but it's just not yet. All the items aren't listed on there, and you need a menu anyway. The only button that's worth having is "Call Server," which we had to do several times in our 40 minutes here. Good things: Our waitress was nice, we got our food quickly. The food was good. Bad: I know this isn't a bar, but we ordered mojitos that were terrible and tasted like sprite with no alcohol. My friend couldn't even drink hers, but with the inability to find a server or someone to talk to, we just wanted to pay and leave because it was getting annoying waiting. We were checked on once, but that was it... like I said the drinks were awful.. I had to track someone down to find boxes (plural... we were brought one... then had to go ask again for another), asked for a lid for some sauce twice... overall just kind of served our food and left to fend for ourselves. I did notice that they saw our full drinks but didn't ask again how it was or if we could get something different or a refund.  The only reason I'm not giving one star is because the food was good. I hate giving terrible reviews, but we won't be back to this location. They need to get a better system worked out of either order everything from a device & fend for yourself, or actually have a human heck on you and make you feel like it's worth spending your money at their restaurant.

Went to Red Robin to celebrate our exchange student's 16th birthday because she loves their shakes. Waited 25 minutes then was sat at our table. Waitress took 5 minutes to address us with I'll be back in "a second" to bring our place settings. 8 minutes later comes back to take our drink order. I asked about the free birthday burger, But she denied it because we did register or exchange student on our loyalty card 24hrs before coming to the restaurant.  Then we all were going to order Monster shakes, but she told us that they are out of milk and therefore out of shakes. "There is a Safeway across the street!" How does a restaurant known for their shakes run out of shakes? So we disappointingly ordered sodas. Then we attempted to order an appetizer, but again we were told they were out of the appetizer. We had to leave and go to another restaurant to get our birthday girl her shake and burger. Red Robin, you failed this customer. It will be awhile before we give you another chance or our money.

FOOD POISONING! I usually love this place but the past three weeks this is what happened. Me and my mother went for burgers on March 5 2017 and they seemed quite good, however when we got home my mother had extremely bad food poisoning and was sick for three days from her burger. I kinda shrugged it off but I went last night March 25 2017 with some friends to have burgers and instantly got sick I've been trapped in my bathroom for 12 hours. I'm done with this Red Robin.  Also it was packed in there, and I understand trying to get food out in a timely manner but... take the time to cook your food properly!! Even my fries came out cold, I should have known something was wrong.

We love this Red Robin, they have always made us feel like family. This is the kids favorite restaurant. Sadly our waitress (Leighton ) has moved to a different restaurant but the other servers are just as attentive and friendly. We started regularly attending this location back 3 years ago sometimes 2-3 times per week. We would only go on nights that Leighton worked and we would sometimes wait quite a while if there were no available tables in her section. We have grown to love everything on the menu and this place has a very relaxed atmosphere. We will continue to visit this location as they have superb customer service and really try to give a level of service above anywhere else to include other Red Robins.

Worried that Red Robin is going down hill! We frequent this place at least one or more times per week. Ordered the salmon meal with broccoli but swapped  out the coleslaw. First of all plate was very hot so the salad was warm and wilted. The broccoli was brown on the ends and didn't taste very good. I asked our server if I could have fries instead of the broccoli because it wasn't good. ( not sure why they served the brown broccoli in the first place.) I then noticed that our server charged us $199 for the fries. So I talked to the manager and she said she would take care of it. So the server had to come over and tell us that she charged us because we shared them. WOW! Since when at Red Robin do people not share their fries?! (Btw the table behind us got 2-rounds of fries with each person getting their own basket plus the fries that come with their meal initially.) not sure why our server had to come over to explain anything anyway? This experience did not bode well with us! Thinking twice on wether we will be back anytime soon.

Two words Kevin and Cody. These two guys provided the BEST customer service we have ever received at Red Robin. Kevin was our waiter and he made sure the drinks were full, we had enough fries and everyone was happy. For a group of 10 this is no easy task and he handled it. Definitely was delivering GOLD STANDARD 5 star service. Cody, I believe was a manager, also came by to make sure everyone was doing well and happy with everything. I wish every place we ate paid attention to detail and cared about customer satisfaction as much as these guys. Food was great, service was EXCELLENT, can't ask for much more then that.

Parking beware! Don't turn into their parking lot. It's a dead end. There's only room for maybe 14 cars and you'll have to make a three point turn. 1) Hostess - Alisha does not make eye contact or greet the customer. You find out the wait time is 15-20 minutes.  2) Every one around you, even the table that comes in 20 minutes after you gets their burger first. (The wait time between getting your appetizer and burgers is nearly 40 minutes! On a Monday night...come on.)

I used to love going to RR. Burgers were always fresh and delicious. Latest experience not so good. I was recommended a tavern burger by my server. Terrible. Tasted just like McDonald's. Maybe their gourmet burgers are still good but based on reviews it doesn't look like it.  Management take note!

This Red Robin is horrible. We haven't been in 4 months because our last experience was horrible. The manager promised to make it right and asked us to come back. 4 months later we come back.. not a single refill on drinks or fries. Not a single "is everything okay". Not a single inquiry. We used the ziosk to pay and leave. As we were leaving the waitress nearly ran into us and said "Oh behind you..." instead of excuse me, or have a good night. HORRIBLE SERVICE. The bathrooms were also flooded and covered in used toilet tissue...

Worst service I have had in a while, the bartenders butt was hungry for her jeans, one of the waitresses decided to carry around her puppy through the restaurant, our personal waitress forgot anything we asked her. Then the food came and that was another horror story - I don't pay $15 for something that looks like it came from a fast food place. The drinks weren't great either. When it came time to pay only half of my party was paying with card, so instead of splitting the bill she decided that she was going to wait for everyone who was paying with card till she finally gave us our bill. So after about 20 minutes we had to ask another server to bring us our bill. Then appears our waitress from nowhere and didn't even know who had what. Tonight was terrible and the service was also terrible. Not happy with "skittles" (is that a stripper name???) and the bartender tonight.

I wish I could give this place 0s. We just ordered to-go food half an hour ago.. got there and my food was sitting on the bar in the to-go bad (who knows how long it was sitting there for) and headed home. Opened my chicken burger that was doused in BBQ sauce. Boyfriend opened his which was doused in teriyaki sauce.. he got about two bites in when he noticed the PINK in the middle. How disgusting. Nothing like getting food poisoning for Thanksgiving. Don't think I'll give this place a second chance when the chance of getting food poisoning is on the table.

Had an amazing Tavern Burger! It was cooked to perfection and the steak fries were fresh and hot. Our server was very sweet and nice. She checked up on us and made sure we had everything we needed.  I left my phone at the table and when I turned around in the parking lot the waitress was pointing to one of the staff who was running up to me! They were incredibly sweet and were in no way required to run across the parking lot to make sure I received my phone. This Red Robin has great food and an awesome staff!

Not the best Red Robin place. I've been here twice, and the quality and the amount of food is less than what I'm normally used to at other RRs, but it will do for now.  My mojito was okay, could have used a bit more sugar and alcohol ;) but it was only $6. All the RRs are being skimpy with their fry servings- you have to ask for refills more frequently, which is a hassle, especially when service is slow. Service here is not the fastest.

Prior to last night, I had never had an issue with Red Robin. My spouse and I decided to eat at Red Robin last night to celebrate. We ordered our food and our server verified our order. I let my sever know that I have a gluten allergy and specifically asked for a lettuce wrap. My server repeated my order with a lettuce wrap substituted for a bun. When my burger arrived, it was placed in a wheat bun. After trying to get my server's attention for over 10 minutes, she finally came over and asked if everything was okay. I told her I had a gluten allergy and asked for the entire burger to be remade. She apologized and took the burger back. After a few minutes, I was presented with a burger in a lettuce wrap. There were crumbs from the bun on the plate - the entire burger had not been remade. The cooks had simply but the burger in a lettuce wrap after I had specified I had a gluten allergy. I tried to get the attention of my server but was unable to for about another 10 minutes. Finally, when I got the attention of my server, I told her that the entire meal needed to be remade because of my gluten allergy. She took my meal away. After 30 minutes of waiting, my meal arrived. I had specifically asked for garlic alioli, as I knew that sauce was gluten free. The sauce on the burger was chipolte aioli, which I was uncertain was gluten free. I again had to wait 7 minutes to try and get the attention of my server before clarifying that the sauce was gluten free. The turkey burger was black and almost inedible because it was burnt, but at this point, I was so frustrated that I didn't care. When my spouse and I went to pay for the meal, we noticed that $20 was taken off the meal. The turkey burger and garlic fries were rung in twice and added an additional $2.75 to the meal. When I asked the server about why this was, she snapped that she had to ring the order in again to have the burger remade and her manager only took $20 off the tab. I asked her to please take off the additional $2.75, as I was not going to pay for a meal that I was unsatisfied with. My spouse and I paid in cash. Our server returned to our table with incorrect change. She gave us $2 instead of $2.06. Eating at Red Robin last night was supposed to be a special treat and celebration - and instead, it was a complete nightmare.

Craving a good burger but was sorely disappointed! Took a while to get our food and when it arrived it looked like it had been sitting under the warming lights too long - wilted lettuce, dried out burgers, yuk! The meat was petrified and I could hardly get it down it was so dry. The portabella mushrooms ( I counted 3 small slivers) and blue cheese sauce (could never locate it but there were 2 small pieces of blue cheese) added little to the flavor! Two thumbs down for you, Olympia Red Robin. Won't be returning any time soon - if ever. Two stars for the server - only cuz we felt sorry for him having to serve such horrible food!
Incredibly slow service in bar area. My onion soup was lukewarm and cheese didn't melt.  Ordered avo cobb salad, nice toppings but barely any salad greens

We came to this restaurant for dinner and they sat us at a dirty table with dirty dishes all around us on the walls next to the table. See pics and someone else's food! We told the manager and she wasn't even upset or apologetic. She instead told us that her busser is behind and moved us to another table. We saw that after our complaint she didn't clean it up neither did the staff. Then we saw a waitress put a tray of food on a dirty table to serve it to people instead of using a stand. Gross Dirty tables everywhere. Then there was some snotty white gunk on the inside of my glass that I was drinking out of. Nasty. My appetite was gone, we began to wonder how clean the back of the restaurant must be if this is how they take care if the front part. For the first time ever we walked out of the restaurant before food was served. A call to the health dept. Is in order.

I usually like red robin. After being in car for hours with my 8 month old son I stopped here with some family for dinner. When we got inside I went to the bathroom to change my son's diaper. Their changing table was out of order and when I asked the hostess if there was any alternative she just said "no sorry" and went back to whatever she was doing. I had to drive somewhere else to change his diaper.

Bottomless fries, you'd like they would give you more than half of a handful on a to-go order! They also put meat on my order.. Im a vegetarian. We live too far away to have exchanged it, so I didn't eat. We love to go to Red Robin but the take away service was terrible!

I live in Tacoma, and this is not my local Red Robin.  However, my local one is horrible, so my bar is set pretty low.  These guys killed it.  Beside the fact I was in a huge hurry.  I had a hungry film crew, and a time constraint.  My original food plan fell through at the last minute, and this was the only place that I could think of that would have everything everyone had originally ordered.  I didn't want to drive back, and ask everyone for a different menu, different plan etc.  I'm in the parking lot of my failed plan, calling, without a menu in front of me, and the guy was a pro!  I'm calling in the middle of the lunch rush, I don't know what I want, at least not what their menu would call it.  He says it will be 25 mins...ugh!  ok, nothing I can do about it.  I arrive there about 10 later, I go in to the bar, he is wonderfully polite, the place is quite busy, and he says, they are bagging it up now.  What?  No way!  We settled the bill, and I was out the door 10 mins later.  Could have kissed him.  Everything was correct, hot, fresh and delicious. Great Job Team Red Robin and thank you for getting right, with a smile, and making me look like a hero!

It's been a while I went to RR.  For some reason, I love their garden burgers (sauce, buns, etc??).  Anyway, it was a busy Friday night in the bar.  I sat at the bar. And got my RR garden burger jones cured until next time. While the "Burger du Jardin" was as good as always, I have to give top props to the bartender, KJ.  That guy hustles his butt all night long!!. Bumped up my review by one star because of him.

Not happy with tonight's service. We didn't have to wait that long to be seated which was nice but the waitress forgot to add our onion rings to the order, I had to ask for our campfire sauce when it didn't come out. They asked if we wanted bottomless fries, my husband said yes. Few minutes later the waitress saw that they never came and asked again and my husband said "no." Got tired of waiting. They never checked on us or offered refills. Service was lousy. It will be awhile before we go back.

Nothing says "Great American cuisine" like nightmare inducing food poisoning. I've been to this location a hand full of times, mostly because they have a strong coupon game and it's an excuse to not cook sometimes. Normally I don't really look to deeply into the quality of chain restaurants, but tonight was a particularly horrible experience. I guess what should have tipped me off was that they won't let you order anything under medium well. Even Applebees let's you order a medium rare burger because they don't use frozen meats. Red Robin does apparently. Really poor quality frozen meat at that. That's really nasty. Secondly, the waiter kinda berated us into buying more food and drinks and told us to smile. In other words, annoying. He also refused to use a coupon that would have been valid and taken 50% off of one of our entrees, even though it was valid for my friend's entree. Instead he took off one of the drinks because he wanted us to stay and drink more.  All of that was pretty terrible, but the kicker was the all night gut cramps followed by an unpleasant morning of hellish evacuation. I'm still kinda sick.  This is not a good place for a burger. Go to West Side.

I use to love this red robin years ago the service is now terrible! I like sitting in the bar but now it is super slow and the server a bigger guy with long hair is super rude! He told me to move when I was looking for a spot! Lucky we had a server that has been there for a while he is super cool. He needs to find somewhere else to work he deserves better. I will never come back to this location unfortunately.

All I can is JASMINE!!!!!!!!!!!! Wow what a fantastic server. She was attentive and on point. She was friendly but not fake like most servers I deal with. Food was good, but service made up for it. She suggested all our entrees and even our beverages!  We will def be coming back for JASMINE!

12:30 on a Saturday over crowded and I begin my experience with holding the lobby door open for the hostess who had to move a double stroller out of the door. She never acknowledge my help with a eye contact or thank you. We sat down with 5 min. Just 2 people. We order food and drinks food came quick about 10 min. As soon as food came she the waitress ask how it was going. I was about two bites in....she never came back for refills or extra fries.. needless to say overrated and not worth the hype..no tip for you lady.

Hungry and in a hurry.... Big mistake, my waitress spent more time talking to her friends at a nearby table than waiting on customers. Mind you I got here after the regular lunch crowd had already finished. By the time my burger came it was already Luke warm. Oh, by the way miss, if you come and ask if I need anything and I say yes, please don't go back to talking to your friends and completely forget... While I was writing this (and she is still talking to her friends) another customer came up and asked if she could get more coffee, no apology no customer service. Olympia Red Robin, do you know what your wait staff is doing?

Red Robin's food is delicious! This particular location is very awesome with consistently great tasting food and awesome service in the bar area!  Red Robin has some tasty burgers! Sometimes I can barely finish a burger...then you have your bottomless fries (that you can substitute with broccoli, sweet potato fries, etc)! I highly suggest their onion rings if you aren't a huge French fry fan, they are really tasty. We have tried a few appetizers and they have been pretty yummy. I'm a big fan of their chili...it has a perfect kick to it and is super meaty and filling! Their wings were cooked good and also had nice flavor.  The bar area has great service. We have seated ourselves each time and the wait staff is always attentive or apologetic if they take a little bit to come to your table (which doesn't happen often, but they are a really busy location). As funny as it may sound, I highly suggest the Nana-Nana-Moo-Moo milkshake! No kidding, it's probably the best milkshake we have had. Also, the Poppin' Purple Lemonade is a great fun drink to get!

I have been to this Red Robin several times and after several mediocre experiences I would definitely not recommend it to anyone I know. I understand that Red Robin's are busy (this one more then most) however even taking that into account the service is sluggish at best and the staff seems to have too much to handle most nights. Making order mistakes, and being forced to send food back is commonplace here so be prepared for a wait. This results in very lackluster service that feels like this restaurant is constantly trying to play catchup. Lastly the food isn't even worth it for the money,  there are much better priced restaurants nearby that have food that puts Red Robin's to shame.

Went here the night of my wedding. Very disappointed. Server was rude mixed up orders Drinks were terrible. I spent $60 on food whose quality should've been $10. We asked if they can remake the drink because all of our drinks tasted the same and she denied it. Apparently my vodka freckled lemonade shouldn't taste like lemonade. There was no apologies no customer service what so ever. I didn't get her name, I don't think she said it, but we came here tonight around 7pm and she was an older blonde lady. Wish I had gotten her name to report her to management

If you are in a hurry on your lunch break, this is not the best place to go, obviously, for those of you who are whiney adults who haven't figured that out lol. Great family place Service is good most of the time (it gets really busy in there) Free ice cream on your birthday! Good ass burgers  Clean I would rate the place at least 3.5 stars or at the most, 4. But I'm giving them a 5 because I think it's absolutely ridiculous that they have less than a 3 on Yelp smh

Great food, four cheese Mac and cheese just has a little cheddar on top though. Great waitress, friendly and funny and very timely, came to check on us multiple times. Four TV's in the bar and tons of parking too!

We went to lunch for my granddaughters 3rd birthday and we were very disappointed. The food was cold when it arrives at our table. The service was not very good. The waitress forgot to bring the drinks. The fries were not cooked all the way.

The service here is ridiculous. We had the unfortunate event of being served by a waitress who had friends or family seated at the table behind us. They were treated like royalty why we had to ask twice for napkins. We were never offered water and both our orders were prepared wrong.  I have food allergies. I specifically asked for no tomato on my chicken sandwich. Their wasn't any tomatoes but they had been added and picked off (lots of seeds and juice attached to the bun).  It's the 1st time in a long time I haven't left a tip and I would never return to this location.

Terrible service! We are literally never returning to another Red Robin. Our server (Cody?) took at least 10 minutes to even get to our table and take our drink order, it was not busy, there were tons of servers on staff working in what appeared to be 4-5 table sections. The table across from us who also had the same server walked out since it was taking him so long to return for their food order. The table behind us had all sorts of issues with not receiving sides or the correct gluten free items they ordered. The hostess refilled our water and daugter's lemonade, another server delivered my boyfriend's beer, the expo or possibly a different server delivered our food, I don't know what our server was doing! My boyfriend managed to snag our server for a fry refill order we got no sooner than 20 minutes after placing it, which at the same time he brought me one as well but not the garlic fries I had originally ordered. We asked for more ranch when we ordered our refill fries, did not get it, from our server or the person who dropped off our fries, finally walked back to the kitchen service area to ask another server for a side of ranch.  Our food was decent, sub par US Foods or Food Service of America standard grub, delivered hot, typical Red Robin cuisine. The bathroom was clean. The hostess and all others staff were great, as we were promptly seated and primarily helped by everyone but our server who didn't even bring us silverware or napkins. The manager on duty who we left a complaint with on our way out was also very sweet and apologetic, not her fault! She checked in with us right after we placed our food order since our table top pad was dying and a previous guest had apparently left a cell phone behind they were searching for. We are fairly understanding people, one of us a small business owner and other a bartender with 14 years in the service industry but this was just ridiculous! What we were hoping to be a quick meal turned into a hour long ordeal lol at least we got a check and box quickly so we could finally escape!

Several reviewers on the internet have mentioned the discrepancy in glass size vs ordered size for Stella Artois at this restaurant. The "16 ounce" size is served in a 33cl/11.1oz glass. I can confirm they do, in fact, pull this scam. Apparently they have been doing this for at least several months. If you do the math, it equates to $2 per glass that you order and do not receive. If you have your receipt and are considering pursuing a resolution, please feel free to ask me about it.  Considering the above, their lackluster service, the under-cooked cold fries, and the slopped together burgers - skip this place. It was once a reliable and enjoyable option; but now is nothing more than screaming kids and dive bar.

Went here for my wife's free birthday burger. Never ever again. We sat in the bar (which by the way was a horrible remodel). The milkshake machine is on the back of the bar. You can hear the blades hitting the metal shake can, then the bartender literally bangs the can on the counter top about 8 times. After that she bangs the metal can on top of the glass that the shake is going into about 8 times. Has this place ever thought of using a spatula? Granted, bars are generally noisier than the rest of the restaurant but come on.  No one likes to hear that jack hammer type noise during lunch. Put the shake machine somewhere in the kitchen. Also, the same story about the fries. Never, never ask you if you want more fries until you've finished your entree. Not too good with a "bottomless fries" slogan. I should have asked for some aspirin for the headache they gave me but that would not show up like the fries. LOL Save some aggravation and go somewhere else.

Yesterday, my coworkers and I stopped in for lunch. My coworker ordered a burger with tomato, lettuce, onions, and NO sauce. He thought he ordered a double-party burger but I don't recall if he actually did. When the food came out, his burger had no tomato, no lettuce, and TONS of sauce. The server (Heidi) offered to have the burger re-made but we didn't have time to get it corrected. When we paid, he chose to pay with cash, and did not receive his change. He did not indicate that she could keep the change, but she did anyway. I am providing this review on his behalf as he was so shocked that so many things could go wrong with his meal that he didn't even know if saying anything would resolve the issues. He also didn't want us to be late getting back to work.

Poor dining room management. A dining room of Empty Tables a Lobby full of people waiting for longer than 15 minutes. Not enough wait staff, we were told.  I ordered a pain burger on lettuce and got cheese. Sent it back, they scraped off the cheese and added goop.  I was sick for a week. Never again.

Food was fine, service was horrible. Maybe they keep the good staff for evening shifts? - I'll go with that assumption. When the bill was over 40 dollars for two people I couldn't help but wish we had gone somewhere else.

Just a heads up for everyone trying to make any reservations, yelp has it listed as they do take reservations, when in fact they do not! you will be sadly mistaken if you try to make a reservation, they will say no, no matter how big your party is.
Their staff is amazing, truly the best waiters and waitresses around, the food is very fast even on busy days and go their about once a week and never ran into any problems

We were almost done with our meal waiting on our refill of fries for over 15 minutes when they came they were not hot and i noticed some ketchup on a few of the fries towards the edge, i figured maybe she was carrying multiple plates of food. when I confronted the manager about the issue on how long it took and that I didn't take them to go since they were room temperature and how I was grossed out there was ketchup on a few of my new order of fries she told me that the only way that could happen is that if the server took them off of another plate and stuck them in a basket and brought them to me. She was a manager helping from a different location and said that is seriously an issue and she would be addressing it. She asked if I already paid i said yes and it was fine i just wanted to bring it to her attention....

I've given this red robin and other red robin's several "second chances" and gone for dinners and lunches and the past 5 times or so (4 at this location) my family and friends have been very disappointed in the service and food. Today will be our last visit. It was not busy and we waited for about 20 minutes after my son asked for more oranges for his lunch and the waitress disappeared and reappeared and we asked again and she said they would be right out. Another 10 minutes went by and we decided to just get boxes for our unfinished meals and she said those would be right out. 15 minutes later and no to go boxes or oranges I got up found a waitress and got the to go boxes. Our waitress came out about 5 minutes later and said "oh someone beat me to it!" Red robin went from being one of our go to's to one of our no's! This has been our experience the last 4 times at the cooper point location. I understand that it takes time to make food but 45 minutes for canned mandarin oranges and to go boxes is ridiculous and to not even get it is even more ridiculous.

Had a really great time with my family here. Hate to see the bad reviews. Some people need to check their attitudes at the door. People are human. Mistakes and slow wait times Happen. I will continue to come to the red robin bc of the wonderful service and food.

Ate here on my lunch break with my boss. The food at any Red Robin is always great. You know what you are getting. However, I have never received such poor service. Our food took over 30 minutes and we were not checked in with at all. Them our food was given to another table and then picked up and brought to us. When we informed one of the servers they had brought us ranch instead of blue cheese they said "close enough"...and were serious. When J asked for the sauce I had requested at time of order it was evident I was inconveniencing the server. My drink was empty for 20 minutes. Management was not present and the environment was frantic at best. I will never spend time at this specific Ref Robin again.

This place is awful. Red Robin used to be so good. The restroom was filthy and there was no toilet paper. If they don't care about the restrooms, how are the sanitary conditions in the kitchen? The service took forever, so when the food came out it was room temperature. Gross, soggy fries. Can't believe I paid $10 for a lukewarm burger. And I'd like to reiterate other sentiments stated about this establishment: staff are standing around just talking to each other. I will never go back and I will discourage others. So disappointing. Perhaps this is what happens to places that close down their flagship restaurants= down the tubes.

Worst food I have had at a Red Robin. You could hear the wait staff and the kitchen staff having difficulties communicating. We ended up with the waitress taking money off our bill because the food was not prepared correctly, sat under the lamp too long, and was just plain old. Boo. We eat at Red Robin a lot, just not this one. We are gluten free, but their online menu is difficult to interact with on a smart phone. This time we ordered salads and they were delivered with no dressing. When they were served again they were drowning in dressing. Yuck. One salad sat under the heat lamp and was warm and wilted. Not good. Unfortunately, I was sick later from the food.

It had been a long long time since we ate here and I wanted a good burger and remembered the RED ROBIN YUMMMMM!  Pretty mediocre.  Dry hamburger buns and non descript sauce on the hamburger.  I did like the cole slaw. Pleasant waitress.  Clean tables and floors.  There are other places to spend this much money and receive a good meal.  Sorry.

They can monkey with new menu items all they like, as long as the keep my A1 Peppercorn burger around. The fries upgrade to garlic especial is NOT worth it - bring your own garlic salt to haphazardly apply on some of your fries, and save a few bucks (for drinks!). The pours are strong, and this place doesn't even let children INTO the bar area, so I'm a regular now. They can do well done respectfully (AKA not ruining the meat!!)!

First time here. Went for lunch around 1pm The Good: They offer a decent lunch menu. Our waitress was very knowledgeable. Bottomless fries Well priced drinks. Burger was delish The Bad: The have the booths packed in here I didnt love the decor or light fixtures. Low ceiling You def get a get em in get em out quick vibe even during off peak times.  Parking is a pain in the A$$ as they have a dead end lot so park in the mall and walk over.

Wow, used to like this place but service has been horrible lately. The food is majorly lacking in flavor and was even cold the last time I went. Went in happy, left really upset. Probably never going back.

i dont typically review chains and franchises but I feel like I need to mention this Red Robin.  This used to be our families go to spot but I really feel that the place is declining, to the point that we will most likely not go back. We arrived around 6:00 on a Wednesday night.  We were sat at a booth and no one acknowledged us for over 10 minutes. I waved someone down to ask if we could get some drinks and was told our server would be with us.  About 5 minutes later a very sweet but inefficient server came over and said she would be with us in a few.  Fast forward 5 minues (20 min of sitting at a table with nothing in front of us).  She took our order and lets just say things went down hill from there.   Drinks took a long time to get there, we ordered an appetizer that came out 20 minutes later and 2 minutes before our main entrees. This always pisses me off. WHY call it an appetizer if you are serving it at the same time as an entree? They forgot my sons food, and after we asked about it, it took another 10 minutes and our food was luke warm waiting for our sons to arrive before we began eating. She forgot salad dressings, and charged me 79 cents  for sour cream for dipping fries into. What the  heck is that all about? They used to bring out a sour cream ranch mix that was free! We didnt have any napkins or silverware for a good 5 minutes into having our food.  No refills on any of our drinks, even though we asked. When I asked to speak to the manager he said they were swamped and that was why service was spotty. He acted as if this should be expected and was grumpy about it too. DID NOT OFFER AN APOLOGY.  He did comp my sons corndog (gee thanks - whatever). Until I hear major improvements have occurred here, I am staying away.  I am  not willing to spend hard earned discretionary money on horrible service even if we do love your steak fries!

Ill admit going to lunch on a Sunday at about 12:30pm, not the best idea. the place wasn't packed when we got there but soon filled up, the service was already slow. the server did greet us right away. My mom ordered the Cobb salad (which has hard boiled eggs on it) and was told by our server that there were no eggs. He explained that they had egg on site but those were only to be cooked for the burgers. their hard boiled eggs come already cooked and the place where they get them back in the Midwest had a bird issue and they had to slaughter over a million birds, (great ting to tell a customer before they eat a meal)  and corporate didn't want them cooking eggs for health reasons. .. but you just told us you have them to cook for burgers? When the salad did arrive (almost 45 min later) it was missing the chicken, we had to ask out server if it was missing and he brought it out on a separate plate.  I also had salad with my meal and I spent a good 5 minutes before I ate it picking out all the slimy lettuce, and when I say slimy i mean you can see through it slimy. I picked around it because we didn't have time to wait for another one. I asked for no cheese, and found a few shreds in my salad as well as melted under my chicken, not a big deal, but if I had been someone who was allergic it could have had a reaction. when our server checked in I explained all the things wrong and asked him to please notify the kitchen so other guests would not be affected, I do not remember receiving an apology and certainly no offer of compensation. I would steer clear of here!!! *update* corporate reached out after seeing this and gave me a $25 gift card, and said they would make sure the location in question was notified.

I have been here many times over the years, and I have never had bad service. The servers themselves are always very friendly and attentive and I give them 5 stars. The food is another matter. Sometimes it's great, sometimes it's just alright. I had a Royal Red Robin burger on ciabatta bread w/ sweet potato fries last time I was there (yesterday). The burger wasn't great, it was really goopy with all the flavorless mayo and the VERY runny egg yolk. The sweet potato fries are good, but they upcharge $1.49 to get them instead of their regular fries, which is crazy for the small amount of fries you get. Burger, sweet potato upcharge, and a Diet Coke cost me $20 after an 18% tip. You can get a lot better food for less money in Olympia, it's just too competitive here to charge those prices for that food.
I love the Red's Tavern double burger without a bun. They always serve it how I like it and the burger is so tasty!!

This is the worst Red Robin location I have ever been to. The seating arrangements are odd and it makes you feel like packed sardines with a bunch of other families. The floors were extremley dirty. It took us so long to get our drinks out that another server asked if we had even been helped yet. When we arrived my 2 year old daughter really wanted a balloon because she normally gets one whenever we go to Red Robin. I told her that when we leave she can have one. As I was coming back from the bathroom near the end of our meal I observed they didn't have any more. My sister went to the front and asked if they had any more balloons and an employee stated they werent making any more for the night. It was 6 o clock on a Saturday night and the restaraunt was packed with other kids. Really? My sister asked if she had any not inflated balloons and the hostess handed her one and a stick. Wow! Seriously?! She needs to not work in the food industry if she is l going to bethat lazy. All in all I am very dissapointed and will not likley return to this location.

I love Red Robin. This location is fine for dining in but DO NOT get take out. Food was cold and I literally got 4 French fries. DO NOT GET TAKE OUT FROM HERE. Also had some weird experiences with the staff here.

Been here more times than I can remember because the food is awesome.  But the experience is certainly lacking.  The floors last night were absolutely disgusting and filthy!  Doesn't look like they had been cleaned all day, covered in bits of food and trash.  It was a very nice day out and very warm and looking forward to eating outside on the patio, but we were informed the patio was closed at 8pm, despite the fact it was still in the 70's outside.  I don't understand the reasoning behind this, is it because the servers are too lazy to walk outside, or...?  Anyway, if I wasn't so hungry I would have left and gone elsewhere.  The only positive experience at Red Robin last night was zero annoying happy birthday songs while trying to enjoy conversation with my party.

Go for lunch instead if you value your hearing. This place is LOUD and BUSY in the evenings. You don't have to be sung to on your birthday if you don't want to be- they'll let you eat in peace. Love love love their freckled lemonade, and their seasoned salt is awesome.

Nice location, just like any other Red Robin. Had the vegan Boca burger - great as always. The waitress was fantastic and added so much extra raspberry to my drink - It was amazing. Totally recommend.
Typical red robin nothing special. I only went because my niece really wanted red robin. I prefer not to go to big chains, local restaurants are always better.
Food and Service are good, BUT very deceitful drink pricing and they charge you to play trivia..unlike Buffao Wild wings.  We wil not be back and they will get nothing but bad press from us.

Several years ago they changed their menu and took off the chicken fajitas, which were great and now they mainly have burgers. Went there the other night and tried something different. Clucks and Shrimp....When the waitress brought it out, I'm thinking "Did she forget something?" There were two small pieces of breaded chicken, mainly breading and about 6 little breaded deep-fried shrimp along with limp, undercooked fries. All that for $13???.....Not quite sure why R.R. is still so popular. It's loud, wait time is usually long and you pay a lot for a little. Hard to say I'll be back again.
Very bad communication on the wait staffs part. Not too sure if I'll be back. The food was good but the communication is a really big thing for me...

They serve old beer... When it comes to Red Robins, this place rates one star. The drinks absolutely blew... both beer and liquor. And yes, I know its "family-friendly". Mondays are a bad day to order any unfiltered beer- bits of hops in it from the "weekly keg weigh in". The food wasn't the dependable RR grub we get up in Seattle- how embarrassing to the RR chain.  Also- letting servers smoke right outside the establishment in their blue polos isn't very attractive.

First our server did not know the fry sauces they offered, which is ok I understand but now I expect you to go find out for me and then come back to let me know. I literally had to google it, at the Puyallup location they have the fry sauce list inside their menu why this Red Robin does not I have no idea!  Secondly when our food arrived I saw the manager bringing it out and then our server took it from him to serve us, this is when I noticed that the top fries on my plate were smashed like something was on top of them and then I found 2 mushrooms stuck to the other side of them. My burger had no mushrooms on them.  Thirdly about 5 minutes into getting our food she drops off the check for us. I really dislike receiving the check in the middle of us eating it felt like we were being rushed out of the restaurant and it wasnt even a busy night!  Fourthly I had to hunt her down to get us more fries, its unlimited steak fries why am I waiting to get more of these? If you run past my table look to see that they are all gone and refill them.  Fifthly I let her know that we needed the check separated and I had a to go order for my husband she quickly seemed very inconvenienced by this, which is ridiculous because the higher my bill the higher your tip. Also in this economy I dont go out to eat very much so when I do I expect great customer service.  Lastly I am a red robin rewards member and I had a coupon for a free dessert she asked me to write the number down on the receipt and she would apply that for me. I wrote down the whole member number for her to come back and rudely tell me she can not do it by the member number it has to be the phone number. Ok.....so I gave her the number. My biggest complaint here is why doesn't red robin ask about the rewards program? Your company really pushed it when I got it and its a great deal but I have never had not a single server ask me if I was a rewards member.

Ok food bad service! Myself my wife and two kids ate there today. The restaurant was not busy and there were plenty of servers.The kids food came first then it took 15 minutes for my wife and my food to show. I asked for a fry refill and never got one :/.we ended up waiting for quite some time for the check. Over an hour and a half for burgers and 1 fry.This was my second bad experience at this red robin I won't be back.
By far the worst location I have been in!  Rude staff and unhelpful management all the way up to the General manager.

Manager (Wayne) called me left message. I called him back and addressed all of our issues regarding our meal in great detail. At the end of our conversation he asked if I would consider giving them another chance. He got my address and said he would send something in the mail. It has been a long time and nothing in the mail. I wrote him a letter regarding the matter. I never asked for ANYTHING! He  offered-all his idea.I just know I did not receive anything nor did I get any response from my letter, of which I may post later. At least I have gotten the point on just how insignificant a customer is to this Red Robin in Olympia. I got your point loud and clear Wayne. If it was my business I would not have treated any customer this way. How on Earth do you make a gourmet Tavern burger raw? The patties are so thin. He explained their 3 stage cooking process and how that shouldn't have happened. But it did!

Red robin has been my favorite place to get a awesome Cobb salad for the past 12 years. My daughter and I used to go almost weekly. They have had awesome servers, food, service and so on. That is until lately. The last time i tried to order to go, the service was horrible, rude, was getting my order wrong, and then hung up. I called back and the service was little better. I've only gone once since. This past Thursday, yesterday, I decided to order out again. My daughter works at the mall so I decided to order two Cobb salads. They were the WORST salads I've ever had. The avocado was Brown, tomatoes were pureed, the lettuce was Brown and 2 of the 4 ranches were chunky and tasted like spoiled mayo.. I am very disappointed..

Old skool that's fo sho.... While the interior is a bit reminiscent of the old location at the Northgate mall in north Seattle, this location has a bit more of a homey feel to it, in a good way! Meal was amazingly served up fast and hot, not all locations can do this!!  And our server was great. Plenty of parking, free french fry refills, what's more to ask?
Service was sketchy. Food was basic. Cleanliness of facility and dinnerware, epic fail! Needs to be closed during the remodel and opened once it's operating to its full and safe capacity.
We have actually stopped eating here.:( It is very sad, but the food is sub-par and the prices are high. The service is still good, but I just can't pay the prices for bad food.

They get 3 stars because the food was good.  One of our burgers didn't have enough Bleu Cheese and the manager came out and handled it right away.  He said, "that is not smiling at you, let me fix it."  However, the waitress was very flat and rushed us to give her our main course order.   When it is a celebration, and a small child, you should not feel rushed when it is a Sunday evening and things are pretty much dying down.  She asked me who was going to pay for my 1 year old's .99 cent drink.  I have never been asked that, but ok.  She didn't even tell us her name.  I would have rather had the nice guy down a couple tables, who would've made us laugh a little and not frown the whole time.   I THINK I will return but to another waitress.  She is lucky she got a tip.  My sister and I came in for our birthdays and unlike other waiters and waitressess, did not sing the traditional song or give us our sundaes.  Even if I come in a couple days after my birthday, without asking they always come singing to our table.   Btw, acknowledge your table first and then it would've been semi ok for you taking 15 minutes to come rush our order.  We would like actual ice water next time not, water that looked like it had been sitting out in the sun.  Wait?  There probably won't be a next time.  Bye bye, Red Robin Royal Burger.

This place has gone to hell in a hand basket! We used to love going there for good food and fast service. Tonight we got crappy food and worse service. How do you screw up a fish and chips order by bringing me a piece of fish and a piece of chicken. It took over 45 minutes with a half full resturant to get an appitizer. We will never go back and suggest this place just find new management and staff and start over

Food is decent. Burgers are your typical good burger. Nothing too much I can say about them. Service is good. Everything is just good. Average. Nothing to right home to mom about. Prices do seem to be on the higher end for what you get.

My rating is based on several trips, not on my most previous one in which I will describe. Waitress was nice but rushed to take our order. Usually I am amazed at how fast the food comes out, but this time I was disappointed, about a half hour. Food was Luke warm when it arrived, including the eight soggy steak frys that came with my burger. Things I have noticed about Red Robin over the years.... the ranch that they used to bring with frys was thick and delicious, now it is watered down. The amount of frys with the burger and that they bring with refills has significantly been reduced. The poor servers have certain lines and routines they must say or do.

Sad to see this place really go down the drain for good. Was always a great default for dining with the kids but the newly updated and more commercialized approach to service has lost this customer for good.

This restaurant was SO dirty!  My party of 3 walked in and not one, but two employees both reviewed the seating chart and didn't offer to seat is (one guy just played on his phone while speaking to us). We didn't have to wait too long before being seated at a table that was dirty. I brushed off the table and booth seat before sitting. The floor was so filthy my sister said something to the hostess, large pieces of food and a napkin were littering the floor. This wasn't the only booth available so I'm not sure why the hostess chose this one. They did send someone promptly to sweep it up. Our waitress Sarah was absolutely wonderful! She is the reason for 2 stars instead of 1. While paying at the new kiosks on the table I had a question. The hostess was walking by so I asked her, she had no clue because she hadn't 'messed with them enough' and referred us to Sarah. Before leaving my sister and I both used the restroom, which smelled of urine - yuck! The one saving grace was our server Sarah, again she was wonderful! The food was good however the cleanliness and overall behavior of the staff (except Sarah) will insure no return visit by me, my sister and my niece.

Something has made a turn for the worse at this location! My husband and I frequent Red Robin almost every time we go see a movie, and this Red Robin has made a drastic change for the worse in the last 6 months!  The last time we ate at Red Robin, I ordered a garden burger (I'm a vegetarian), there was a mystery chunk of bacon in my burger! Wtf? And, half was HARD. I don't even know!  Another time, my Mother-in-law received her burger WITH THE PAPER FROM THE CHEESE COOKED ONTO IT! It was almost funny how bad that was.  It seems like they used to get their orders right, and their food used to be cooked like you asked it...  Anyways, this Red Robin needs to put more details into cooking the burgers and maybe improving on the soggy fries...

The wifey and I came here on a Friday evening. It was busy, as expected, but we still got a seat after 5 minutes of waiting. Our waiter was really nice and everyone working here was very attentive with the refills, which is amazing in itself. The food was as expected at a chain restaurant...consistent. The banzai burger sans bun was delicious as expected and the Bruschetta Chicken sandwich was also delicious as well. The best part is the basket of bottomless fries! Of course everything is so big and filling, you cant actually eat a ton of them, but if you have the munchies or you've been starving for the last week, this is awesome. Overall the wait staff was attentive, fast, and nice; the food was yummy. A classic Red Robin experience.

The Dirty Bird - and for good reason.  This place is like a 50's dinner and McDonalds had a baby and then that baby grew up and went to college and partied a lot.   Ambience:  Loud.  Bustling. A little cramped even though there is a billion tables.  Prepare to shout your conversation if you want to be heard.  Colorful. Fun? Staff:  This RR had a very young staff.  Lots of busy little servers, expos, hosts and bussers running around to make the place run well.  Red Robin staff is cheerful and helpful.  Though they will make a spectacle of you on your birthday. Food:  The food is standard american fare.  Burgers is the focus for your protein and fries (lots of them) for your starch.  Every sauce imaginable is ready at your request.  They have a lot of TALL food it seems... a onion ring tower and a mile high mud pie.  Good food all around.  I love the whiskey river BBQ burger and the Teriyaki Chicken Burger. Bottom line:  The food is pretty good.  Good place for kids because they can scream and no one will hear them over the din in that place.  They can color all over everything and the staff is pretty cool about it since they are all 15 years old.  There is a person in a costume that will scare them or make them happy. (It's a toss up for my kids)  Great for groups... we brought a party of 52 there one time with no reservation and they worked it out.  That was impressive.  If you have a big group most people in your party can agree to eat here since they have something for everyone.  The staff is always friendly about splitting checks and they have a built in 18% gratuity. It's not my cup of tea.. but I can see why people like it.  All you can eat fries with your burger is nice.  Though the food is pretty good I can't ignore the AMBIENCE.  RR put a lot of eggs in the ambience basket and I'm afraid it's either you love it or hate it... I happen to hate it.  Besides the guy in the bird costume scares my kids and flirts with my wife and then stays at my table for an hour... you can feel my pain.  Still,  I would recommend it for a fun night at dinner with the kids or some friends.

Food is decent but the service is god-awful. Appetizers brought with no plates or silverware. We eventually had a passing bus boy grab us some plates. Food was tasty but lukewarm. Our server never checked on us and I had to walk to the drink station to refill my own dr pepper. I NEVER complain but asked to speak to the assistant manager, who explained that our server is new and comped us the appetizer and sodas, which was appreciated. Our snotty server brought our check back without a word. If she'd apologized for poor service she could have saved her tip! Not sure if we'll return to this RR location again. It's gone seriously downhill.

I'm really not a chain restaurant kind of gal.  But sometimes, when I'm dragging the kids around, or meeting other people with kids, you just gotta go with the flow.  Because of its central location between various cities, we eat here a lot more often than I'd like to admit.   I can't imagine coming here with a group of like minded adults to drink beer and eat burgers, however, I won't deny that for kids meals, you can't really beat Red Robin.  A kid-friendly entree, vegetable and soda for about the same price as a a happy meal?  Sold! This particular Red Robin is no better or worse than anything out there. If you are getting bad service, ask for a manager, they'll fix the problem.  The food comes out fast, I've always had decent service, and the bathrooms are clean.  And really, that's all a mom can ask for.  That and that none of the kids drops a milkshake on themselves, but I can't hold Red Robin accountable for that fantasy, right?

Red Robins is a good place to eat if you try the right things.  When I eat here I get just the cheese burger the rest of the burgers are bland. The donut desert is gross the dough in the middle is raw the dipping sauces are so sticky and thick they only stick to the serving bowls. The service is slow, often I have had to get my own utensils. The appetizers are not all that great, but if I am really hungry I order the zucchini and cheese fried sticks.  The kids meals are very plain, but make for a good inexpensive lunch, just sprinkle the food with the season salt provided at the table.  It's about the same cost as Burger King but at Red Robins you get better fries and a larger meal.

Typically i am a Red Robin fan. Well priced food, quick service, and decent food. The Olympia Red Robin fails to deliver on every aspect. I have been in this particular location multiple times and always leave asking myself why i put myself through that! The food is below that of every other Red Robin i have been to and the service is just as poor.  This last trip was so bad that the manager ended up comping our entire meal (family of 4) The waiter completely forgot to put our order in and instead of coming by to make it right and apologize, he blatantly ignored us while we waited and watched everyone around us come and go. Even when we finally received our food, we were less than impressed. It is just not made the same as other Red Robins.  There are definitely other places in Olympia worth going to. Do not recommend this particular Red Robin in the least!

First off I have a 11 month old and I am severely allergic to mushrooms this being said I never get out with my husband. Tonight after some Christmas shopping we stopped at red Robbin for some dinner. We waited about 20 mins to sit and once seated we quickly ordered some appetizers the pretzel bites and the poutine WITHOUT MUSHROOMS. We waited some time for them as the kitchen was backed up, upon arrival everything looked good my husband started in on the pretzels I looked over the poutine for mushrooms and didn't see any so I took a bite of the fry covered in gravy and cheese...after eating that steak fry I looked down and there under the top layer of fries lay a bunch of mushrooms. My husband jumped up to get the waitress and she took our fries. Less then 3 minutes later a "new" poutine came out, it was cold and from the way it came out looked like someone had just picked the mushrooms out, I asked the waitress if this had been made completely mushroom free because of my allergies I didn't feel comfortable eating it, she said she was sorry and she wouldn't feel comfortable eating it as well, and would have them make me a new poutine without mushrooms. The item charge was taken off our bill and the 3rd time it came out great.... I started feeling sick half way into the hour long wait it took for us to get our cold burgers, our 11 month old was over this experience as well thankfully he was being as great as he could be as we had now been there for almost 2 hrs. I realized on our ride home I was having an allergic reaction I started dry heaving and then started throwing up, I called the manager and his customer service came off rude as he repeated over and over "what am I suppose to do about it." After a few minutes of getting frustrated and feeling like I was going to vomit I ended the conversation with a happy holidays. I payed for a meal that I completely just threw up. After some Benadryl and Allegra and a few more bathroom visits I'm now furious.

The staff was really nice. The parking here is terrible. Seriously, I have never seen parking worse than this. But the food is great and the service is better. Usually not a very long wait when we come here. We are big fans of red robin. It's just a great restaurant to bring out kids to. Plus they have great beer on  tap.

Good basic burger place. Very Family friendly. If you do not like children, stay out. Little rascal kept kicking my seat. Very good, fast service.  Good basic burger and sandwich place with out of the bag fries.
Typical Red Robin restaurant, loud and busy during rush hour.  The food is excellent, waiter was great and the bonzai burger is the best.

I wish I could give them 0 stars. 1 isn't even what they deserve. I came here with 3 friends and it was busy so we sat at a table in the bar area as soon as the previous guests left so it was still in need of a cleaning. It took 5 mins for someone to greet us and she said she would be right back to wipe down the table. About 5 mins later she came and wiped it down and we ordered Drinks, as well as asked for a basket of fries since we were all going to order meals anyway. The server said we would have to pay for a side of fries and we couldn't get a basket of the bottomless fries that comes with our meals until we all ordered food. And that they don't give the fries out like that anymore. We were still waiting for one person to join us so we didn't end up ordering our meals yet. We were shocked as that is a very normal thing to happen at red robin and it seemed a little weird we were told that when every other time in our lives we have gotten French fries before our food orders no problem. Shortly after that a different server came and said she would be serving us. I guess the original server didn't want to help us anymore as she served everyone around us still. The second server was polite and had no problem bringing fries out for us. Thanks to her she changed our experience around.

I will never go back to this location again - the staff stole my sunglasses after I left them on the table! Over the years I've been to Red Robin a fair amount - in multiple locations.  Overall, they're not too bad.  This location was always good until my most recent visit.  I and two friends went in around 8 pm on a recent Wednesday evening.  We sat in the bar because it wasn't very crowded.  We ordered, ate, had relatively decent service - really, no complaints.  However, I accidentally left my sunglasses on the table when I left.  Had they been cheap sunglasses I wouldn't have cared but these were Coach aviators which cost a material amount.  I called the next morning when I realized I didn't have them.  I'm not one to misplace my things and I searched my car and house from top to bottom - there really is no other explanation.  Also, I distinctly remember taking them off my head and placing them on my table.  I spoke with multiple people over the next few days to no avail.  On at least two occasions they said they would get back to me and did not so I kept calling.   I will say, the Assistant Manager (I think his name was Jerry) was very understanding and eager to help.  It's unfortunate I cannot say the same for the General Manager (GM) or anyother staff I spoke with.  I was told I would get a call from the GM the next time he was at the restuarant but they never called.  At that point, I had been calling for about a week trying to get some resolution but eventually gave up, convinced that an employee simply walked off with my sunglasses. This whole situation has been really disappointing.  Decent and quick service means nothing if the staff at this particular location have no integrity or respect for the customers they are supposed to serve.  The only way I will go back to this location is if I velco all my belongings to my body to prevent the sticky-fingered staff from making off with my stuff.

They really need to improve speed in general and reduce the waiting time. For example, They got plenty of tables but not enough servers there. So it took 10 mins to take my order, 30 mins waiting for my food plus additional time for my fries refill.

I've been here a few times with my boyfriend. I really like their burning love burger. But since they are a burger place, they better be able to do it right. For the most part their fries are really good too, plus, they are bottomless.  The biggest complaint i have is the service. (some of the time) I've gotten great service if they aren't busy. But if they are busy, be prepared to be ignored. They give the servers too many tables and don't have enough servers on to properly take care of the amount of people coming in the door. Don't even try asking another server to get you condiments because all the servers only care about their tables. The ones will be tipping them.

Took my daughters out to lunch on our girls day last weekend. Our waitress as nice enough, what little we saw of her. However, we never got a single refill on our drinks or bottomless fries. Our food arrived cold. My youngest daughter got the fish and chips. The fish was dripping grease! I ordered the chicken Caesar wrap. I don't think they dried off the lettuce(?) that's my only explanation for the soggy wetness of the wrap. After the third bite of chicken that I could not even chew, I gave up. My other daughter got a chicken salad that was equally unimpressive.  The waitress never came back for us to offer any complaints. We paid our bill at the table kiosk and left disgusted. In addition, on our way out I stopped by the restroom which was FILTHY!! The floor was so dirty that my feet actually stuck to it!!! Mind you we were there before noon on a Saturday. They had just opened at 11am. I'm guessing the restrooms were not cleaned the night before. Judging by the condition, maybe not for several nights!! This place is disgusting! The health department should pay a visit. No way I would ever go back or recommend anyone to dine there!!

We went in to eat on 10/07/13, waiter was more interest in refilling the mixed drinks of the people at the table next to us instead of taking care of the people eating.  It took 40 mins to get 2 burgers and the Cod platter, and the food was mediocre.  We will not be returning to this location.
The service here sucks. That's the main reason I gave this place a two. The service is so slow and the servers almost always forget at least one thing. The food is pretty good though.

This particular RR is a favorite!!!!  I cannot find fault in any part of their show.  Food is consistently good.  Wait persons are exceptionally attentive.  I often give gift cards during the holiday season, as we are a family of RR fans!!!!!!!

Saturday lunch crowd.  Waited 10 minutes to walk by 4 booths before the stuck us at a tiny table on the greenhouse side.  So we changed tables which irritated the staff but get over it because I'm a big guy and I don't like to look like I'm eating out of my lap especially when I'm paying for it.   The burgers were okay, nothing to right home about.  The bun was really dry and kind of fell apart.  I got the royal burger and outside of the bun the meat was pretty dry with a typical taste or generic char.  Barely any cheese.  Enough lettuce and tomato to make my own salad after the burger. Of course the steak fries are the only thing good.  The shake I got was decent too. It's been about 3 years since I went there last and I am definitely in now hurry to go back in the next three years.

The service & quality are definitely degrading at this Olympia location.  My wife & I ate at there Sat night about 9. The hostess practically pushed us into lounge.  Neither of us are drinkers but hey that's cool if we get served faster, right?  Order's finally taken and we wait...& wait...& wait: 1 hour!!  When the meals arrive, they are ok but my cheeseburger was pretty bland, not what you'd expect for $8.89 anyway. Sandy got the fish & chips & they were greasier than usual.  We've eaten at the Oly location for 20 years and this is the worst I've seen.  Suspect new management is the root problem but who knows.  I will avoid this one until I see better reviews in the future.

I have never been able to decipher their theme.  To me, the combination of the Statue of Liberty at the front entrance and the hodge-podge of "art" on the walls makes me dizzy.  But I like their food and the service is good, and the bottomless fries are a big draw.

I am a Red Robin expert....I've been dining at RR for years!!! Literally for over 13 years I've enjoyed the food.  This was the worst RR i've ever came to.  The service was fast and friendly....exactly what I'm used to!  For some off the wall reason, i've been hooked on the blue ribbon burger for the past 5 years....I simply can not order anything else.  Even though I was tempted to try a new burger.....I gave in and went with my original order.  The burger when it arrived was HORRIBLE.  In Eugene (Where I live) they use a onion bun, but it's not like the onion bun they used up in olympia.  The one in olympia crumbled and fell apart.....it was literally a onion bun that looked like it was from Franz breads or something.  Just a really low class bun, the chipotle was weak and hardly even there....Blue cheese was hardly there, the onion straws were damn near onion rings,  and it simply looked just shitty!!  The blue ribbon burger i'm used to down here at home is 100% different than what I had in Washington. I will not be eating at this RR location ever again.
I could eat a whisky river bbq burger every day. Some days the burger is better than others....but they are never bad. Eat in the bar to avoid the annoying birthday songs.

Burgers are fantastic, of course, but what's always impressed me is how efficient they are, especially when very busy. The employees are hard working and very diplomatic when dealing with the inevitable jerks. I don't envy them and I don't think I could do that job, but I'm glad someone can! I also appreciate that they do offer some items for vegetarians (and you can get any burger with a GardenBurger patty).

We visited this location on 8-29-12 on our way back from Seattle, we were seated right away but it took 17 min for our waitress to take our order. We ordered 3 prim rib dips, one without horseradish and regular fries, and 2 with garlic fries and a grilled turkey burger with regular fries. 2 cokes, 1milk, and a coffee we asked for all the drinks to come together, all the drinks came except the milk. Our waitress said it would be right out after that we did not see our waitress until we were done eating. we wanted refills but no waitress. The milk came out with the food 25 min later. When the food finally came out the prime rib we asked for no horseradish had horse radish and garlic fries, every thing else was ok. The manager came over and apologized for the mistake and we asked for refills, he said he would send someone over, but no one showed up. He brought us a new prime rib in 4 min(why did it take so long before, they were not that busy) when he brought it back it still had garlic fries, he said he would take it off the bill and get us one with out garlic fries, we kept it and ate so we could get out of there. Our waitress finally showed up (still no refills) and gave us our check, we paid cash, 2 dollars over the amount. She came back and we complained about the service and she got mad at us, grabbed the money and stormed off and disappeared, so she only got a 2 dollar tip. We will never goto this Red Robin again.

Red Robin is a great place to get burgers. They are known for their burgers. I've been there many times. If you like the fanfare with all the waiters/waitresses singing happy birthday to you, Red Robin is definitely the place to go to. It's a lot of fun, and I think everyone really enjoys it. The atmosphere is very family oriented, and very friendly. The staff are very nice and helpful. The food is exceptional, and I would rate this particular store with 4 stars with an exception. On a couple occasions they have actually managed to run out of beef and french fries! Crazy!

GROSS!!  we met some friends for dinner.  The service was slow and way too stepford wife cheerful.  The place was painfully noisy.  The food was just so mass produced.  It was semi-edible as far as chain restaurants go.  By that I mean like McDonalds is semi-edible, BUT NOT as good as McDonalds.  But, with that lukewarm endorsement, I must say that I felt sick after I ate.  Not the-I think I have ecoli sick, but sick with a heavy gut feeling and awful headache from all the hormones, chemicals and cups of sodium that each lab created "signature" dish contains.  It SUCKS!  For the love of god, just keep driving!!!

The food is always dependable, but the service is REALLY inconsistent.  Sometimes you have food 10 minutes after ordering, but as of now we have been waiting 30 minutes for a kids meal and a burger and can't find our server to ask about our order.  UPDATE: after 32 minutes we got lukewarm mac n' cheese and a cold burger with cold, burned sweet potato fries.  They "remade" it and I got an overcooked burger and the same burned sweet potato fries back.  To their credit, they did comp the burger.  2nd UPDATE:  Went back last week to give them another shot.  Burger was only slightly better than last time, the campfire sauce hadn't been mixed well so it was full of big white chunks of something (mayo?).  The fries were great this time.
Well this Red Robin is great, as Red Robins go but you pretty much have to park across the street at the mall and walk over. Which is fine unless it's raining.
I've been going to the Red Robin for years. I have tried every burger on the menu. I'd eat here more often but my cardiologist might kill me before the burgers ard fries will.
